API Key with permissions.name: Authorization
API Key with permissions.description:
A Control Room API key with the necessary permission(s) granted.
Prefix the API key value retrieved from Control Room with RC-WSKEY.

details.description: Details are only available when the process run was started by a `user`

form_data.description: The form data fields you must include when uploading the task package bundle

error.description: An object containing the error code, if the run failed.

next.description: The full URL to access the next set of results. Null if there are no next set of results.

has_more.description: Whether or not there are more elements available after this set. If false, this set comprises the end of the list.

get.description:
Returns a list of all link tokens for the requested worker group.
**Note:** For security reasons, the link token value can be retrieved in Control Room only.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the worker group resides.

parameters.name: worker_group_id
parameters.description: The id of the worker group to which the link tokens belong.

200.description: List of Worker Group Link Tokens

Generates and returns a link token used to link a worker to the requested worker group.
**Note:** For security reasons, the link token value can be retrieved in Control Room only.

parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the worker group resides.

parameters.name: worker_group_id
parameters.description: The id of the worker group to which the link token belongs.

requestBody.description: The name of the worker group link token to create

get.description: Returns a paginated list of process runs. If a process id is specified in the query parameters, the response will only contain process runs from that process. If not, the response will contain the process runs of the workspace in the path.

parameters.name: process_id
parameters.description: Process ID, if specified, the response will only contain the process runs from this process

post.description:
Starts a process run for the requested process.
This endpoint is useful when you don't have control over the **headers** and / or **request body** of the caller and need a plain URL. This includes e.g. certain integration cases.
The **full request body** will be provided as the input work item for the process run.
The **API Key** must be provided as the value of the `token` query-string parameter.
This endpoint supports **webhook handshakes** for added security. Currently we support the protocol employed by [Asana](https://asana.com/).
If you are using Asana, use the `with_handshake=asana` query string parameter when constructing the URL to enable Asana webhook handshakes.

requestBody.description:
Any valid JSON payload.
The full request body is passed as a work item to the process run input.

post.description:
Starts a process run for the requested process.
You may choose to start a process run without work items, with specified work items, or with the work items that are waiting in the input queue of the specified process.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the process resides.

parameters.name: process_id
parameters.description: The id of the process to start.

requestBody.description: Omitting the request body will start a process run with either the default work item, if configured, or an empty work item.

work_item_ids.description: Work item ids to start the run with.

oneOf.description: This signals that a new process run was not started. This happens when a process run start with Input Work Items is requested, but no Input Work Items are available.

get.description: Returns a process run

delete.description: Deletes a process run. This action is irreversible!

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the robot resides.

parameters.name: process_run_id
parameters.description: The id of the process run to delete.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the process run resides.

parameters.name: process_run_id
parameters.description: The id of the process run to stop.

requestBody.description: Set whether or not to set the remaining work items as done or terminating the ongoing activity runs, as well as the reason for stopping the process run.

get.description: Returns a list of all processes linked to the requested workspace.

post.summary: Retry, delete or mark work items as done
post.description:
Run a batch operation on one or more work items.
You can retry, delete or mark failed work items as done.

get.description: Returns a paginated list of work items. You can specify filtering work item by state, process_id and process_run_id using the query parameters.

post.description: Create a work item for the requested process.

get.description: Returns a work item for the requested process. You can specify whether you want to also retrieve the work item's data (payload and/or files) by supplying the `include_data` query parameter.

post.description: Request to upload a work item file.

requestBody.description: The name and size of work item file to create

form_data.description: The form data fields you must include when uploading the file

put.description: Update the payload for the requested work item.

requestBody.description: The updated payload of work item

get.description: Returns a list of all outputs for the requested process run.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the process run resides.

parameters.name: process_run_id
parameters.description: The id of the process run for which to list the process run outputs.

post.description: Creates a new task package with the given name in the requested workspace.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace in which to create the task package

requestBody.description: The name of the task package to create

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace in which the task package resides

parameters.description: The id of the task package to get the download link for

get.description: Returns a URL + form data payload for uploading the task package bundle.

parameters.description: The id of the workspace in which the task package resides

parameters.name: task_package_id
parameters.description: The id of the task package to get the upload link for

200.description: Task Package upload URL and form data fields

delete.description: Deletes a specific task package. This action is irreversible!

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the task package resides.

parameters.name: task_package_id
parameters.description: The id of the task package to delete.

get.description: Returns a list of all assets linked to the requested workspace.

post.description: Creating an asset is a multi-step process, see Create an asset upload to specify the data.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the worker should reside.

get.description: Returns an asset for the requested workspace. The asset is returned including its payload.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Asset ID or Asset Name prefixed with `name:` e.g. `name:my-asset-name`

delete.description: Deletes the requested asset. This action is irreversible!

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The id of the workspace on which the worker resides.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Asset ID or Asset Name prefixed with `name:` e.g. `name:my-asset-name`

post.description: Create an upload for the requested asset payload. For payloads with less than 5MB you can upload the contents directly on the upload creation by specifying the data field. For larger uploads you can create the upload and use the returned upload URL for uploading the contents.

parameters.name: asset_id
parameters.description: Asset ID or Asset Name prefixed with `name:` e.g. `name:my-asset-name`

get.description: Get the upload of an asset.
